label: A2B_oP12_19_2a_a-001
title: Nauminnite (Ag$_{2}$Se II) Structure
comments:
(Mehl, 2017) makes two significant errors in describing this structure: \begin{itemize} \item (@iegers, 1971) used a non-standard representation of space group $P2_{1}2_{1}2_{1}$ \#19, while we assumed the standard representation. \item We inadvertently used the (Wiegers, 1971) Wyckoff positions for Ag$_{2}$S rather than Ag$_{2}$Se. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 We regret these errors, which are corrected here. 
 (Wiegers, 1971) states that this is the low temperature form of nauminnite, stable below $133^{\circ}$C. He notes that this structure disagrees with \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP12_17_abe_e-001}{structure found by (Pinsker, 1965)}. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP12_19_2a_a-001}{AgO$_{2}$ II} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP12_19_2a_a-002}{$\beta$-SnF$_{2}$} have the same AFLOW prototype label, A2B\_oP12\_19\_2a\_a. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
